Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black;with two added white lines; exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx standing to left (parts of hair and curlicue; wing and body with added red patches, dotted underbelly and tops of legs remaining).
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as belonging to the third stage of the Group of the Simple Figures. The vases in this group were probably all produced by the same hand. The leading vase from this group is the Tarentum chalice (Lemos 1991, no. 938). Flat-headed passant sphinxes with long hair falling in three separate tresses are a recurrent theme.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p.131, p. 288, no. 847, pl. 118)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1045) (phase 2)
